timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -215,7 +215,9 @@ private RxDocumentServiceRequest createQueryDocumentServiceRequest(Map<String, S
         switch (this.client.getQueryCompatibilityMode()) {
         case SqlQuery:
             SqlParameterList params = querySpec.getParameters();
-            Utils.checkStateOrThrow(params != null && params.size() > 0, "query.parameters",
+            // SqlQuerySpec::getParameters is guaranteed to return non-null SqlParameterList list
+            // hence no null check for params is necessary.
+            Utils.checkStateOrThrow(params.size() > 0, "query.parameters",

timeline.author: moderakh

timeline.bodyText: bug: I don't think you need Nullable from this lib.
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: @moderakh  - Though everywhere in the code, we have this annotation (from micrometer). But I agree, we should replace this with @reactor.util.annotation.Nullable as there is no need to depend on micrometer for Nullable annotation
replies.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText: yes, we can use micrometer or reactor, both have same effect. Or better, we could use javax.annotation.Nonnull, (which is used by micrometer or reactor Nullable annotations).
replies.author: anuchandy

replies.bodyText:
My concern with javax.annotation.Nonnull  -> I recently tested our SDK with Java 11 and this was giving issues as there is no module for javax, so I had to change them to reactor Nullable annotation.
Though java 11 is far in the future, but something worth considering.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText: thanks, Kushagra for sharing this, sounds good, will use Reactor NonNull
replies.author: anuchandy

replies.bodyText: done in the lastest commit.
replies.author: anuchandy

timeline.bodyText:
This change is a bit concerning to me. I will verify if equals is being called anywhere for ResourceId.
@moderakh  - do you know any of the places where we do so ?
timeline.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText:
I know we have a clone() method in this class, but usually its not recommended to use clone() and Cloneable interface, as it is flawed.
https://stackoverflow.com/a/11654256
I doubt if we are actually calling this clone method, worth checking and removing it if not being called.
timeline.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText:
it seems we're using it here 
  
    
      azure-sdk-for-java/sdk/cosmos/azure-cosmos/src/main/java/com/azure/cosmos/implementation/directconnectivity/ReplicatedResourceClient.java
    
    
         Line 126
      in
      12acd7a
    
    
    
    

        
          
           RxDocumentServiceRequest freshRequest = request.clone();

timeline.bodyText: StdDeserializer already implements Serializable

replies.author: anuchandy

replies.bodyText: There are other places i saw StdDeserializer without extra implements , so i think only serializerId is needed and this can be remove , please give it a try

replies.bodyText: @simplynaveen20 thank you, I double-checked, yes, only the serializationVersionId is required. I've updated the PR that removes extra implements.
